author: brane
msg: /me is a bit rusty in shell...
Don't tee off output from build commands, because that hides the real
return code. And use sendmail instead of mailx, because mailx doesn't
support the -t option on all machines, while sendmail does (or should).

author: sussman
msg: Make 'svn diff' display property changes.  Mostly.
I have put the property-diff display code into display_prop_diffs().
If this change starts a bikeshed discussion, people can toy with this
-- issue 685:  'svn diff -r N:M' can't show complete propchanges on
directories yet.  We need to extend the RA vtable, I think.
-- issue 686: when doing 'svn diff -r N', the server actually sends
*reverse* propchanges.  we need a way to reverse these meanings
so they print out correctly!  Maybe Philip can provide insight
here.  I can think of a painful way to fix this.
(diff_props_changed):  check for prop mods on files, call the helper func.
(struct file_baton, dir_baton):  add two property lists to these batons.
of the file, store in file_baton for later.  (struct file_baton):
* libsvn_wc/diff.c (file_diff): if props are modified, call
grab propdiffs, pristine props, or both.  this is the gstein style

author: cmpilato
msg: Starting the work of getting updates spanning disjoint URLs to work.
svn_ra_local__do_status): Use new make_reporter_baton() helper to wrap
the report baton returned by the repos layer.

author: sussman
msg: Finish up the massive rewrite of 'svn diff'.  Comparison of two
arbitrary URLs should work now, including the optional @rev syntax
[ Local rumors have it that diff_tests are failing over DAV, as of my
first commit yesterday.  I'm going to check this out now. ]
revisions passed to this routine *must* be specified.
* diff.c (do_diff): huge comment regarding how svn_client_diff works.
Also, rewrite this routine to be more generalized, and handle
* CHANGES:  start new user-visible changes section.
